data.title: Jim Cramer spots 8 'instant winners' after China's Wuhan lockdown lifted
data.text: "With the opening of Wuhan last night it's a whole new ballgame for the second largest economy in the world," the "Mad Money" host said

data.title: This new normal 'matters for your life and your portfolio,' Jim Cramer says
data.text: "Even when the lockdown ends, though, you have to be prepared for a new world that looks very different from the old world," the "Mad Money" host said.

data.title: How Far Have Apple's Earnings Estimates Fallen During the Coronavirus?
data.text: Apple (AAPL) flashed early warning signs to Wall Street about how the coronavirus might impact companies with exposure to China, and that was all the way back on February 17.

data.title: Apple's Over-the-Ear Headphones Reportedly Launching in June
data.text: Apple tipster Jon Prosser said Apple will also launch a new AirPod model in the fall aimed at sports enthusiasts.

data.title: Apple Allocates $50 Million to Support Indie Artists and Music Labels
data.text: The music streaming giant will pay advance royalty payments amounting to $50 million to certain independent record labels.

data.title: Apple Chases Facebook Into the VR Market With a $100 Million Acquisition
data.text: Apple revives its VR efforts by scooping up a startup at a steep discount.

data.title: Apple Sales Estimates Cut As Retail Stores Remain Closed
data.text: Apple retail store closures as a result of the Covid-19 pandemic are going to take a bite out of the company's sales in first-half 2020. The impact could spill into third quarter.

data.title: Apple's (AAPL) $50M Fund to Support Amateur Indie Musicians
data.text: Apple's (AAPL) latest effort to fight the coronavirus pandemic includes its offer of a $50-million advanced royalty fund for independent record labels.

data.title: Apple price target cut at J.P. Morgan as analyst takes 'much harsher look' at sales volumes
data.text: J.P. Morgan analyst Samik Chatterjee lowered his price target on Apple Inc. shares AAPL, -1.15% to $335 from $350 Wednesday, writing that he has taken a "much harsher look" at sales volumes for the June quarter and even the September quarter due to "limited" customer engagement during the COVID-19 outbreak.
